title: Implement settings screen
description:
# Implement Settings Screen

## User Story
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** to modify application settings from the UI
**So that** I can customize the TUI behavior without manually editing config files

## Description

Create a settings screen accessible from the ContextualTopBar (SOUL-55) settings button. Users should be able to edit TuiConfig fields and apply changes without restarting the application.

## Context

The ContextualTopBar (SOUL-55) will provide a settings button/icon. This ticket implements the settings modal/screen that appears when the settings button is clicked.

Similar to configuration interfaces in other TUIs, this should provide an organized view of settings grouped by category.

## Technical Notes

**File to Create:**
- src/consoul/tui/widgets/settings_screen.py

**Integration:**
- Listen for ContextualTopBar.SettingsRequested message
- Push settings screen as modal using app.push_screen()
- Load current TuiConfig values
- Handle field edits with validation
- Save to config file on confirmation
- Apply changes dynamically where possible

**Settings Categories:**
- Appearance (theme, show_timestamps, show_token_count, show_metadata)
- Performance (gc_mode, gc_generation, gc_interval_seconds)
- Behavior (show_sidebar, auto_generate_titles)
- Advanced (streaming settings, model defaults)

## Acceptance Criteria

**Given** I click the settings button in ContextualTopBar
**When** the settings screen opens
**Then** I see all configurable TuiConfig options organized by category

**Given** I modify a setting value
**When** I save the changes
**Then** the config file is updated with new values

**Given** I change the theme setting
**When** I apply changes
**Then** the TUI updates to show the new theme without restart

**Given** I change sidebar visibility
**When** I apply changes
**Then** the sidebar shows/hides immediately

## Dependencies

**Prerequisites:**
- SOUL-55 (ContextualTopBar must exist with settings button)
